intro: Drypetes guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan drypetes, is a deciduous tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The tree produces a yellowish latex when cut, which is a distinguishing feature. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in lowland tropical regions. The plant is often found in secondary forests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
